intro: Physalis longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed groundcherry, is a herbaceous annual plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and oval, yellow-orange fruits enclosed in a papery calyx. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow with five petals, and the fruit ripens to a bright orange color. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits, which are similar to tomatillos.
